About

I'm Brandon, a cloud architect and software developer based in the US. I design and build infrastructure for companies of all sizes, and I write about what I learn along the way.

My work focuses on cloud infrastructure, DevOps automation, and building reliable systems that scale. I've spent the past several years helping teams adopt cloud-native practices, implement CI/CD pipelines, and improve their operational workflows.

I started this blog as a way to document solutions to problems I've encountered. If something took me hours to figure out, maybe I can save someone else that time. My writing covers all sorts of topics such as AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, and general software engineering topics.

When I'm not working, I contribute to open source projects and experiment with new technologies. I'm particularly interested in infrastructure as code, observability, and developer tooling.

Get in touch

I'm always happy to chat about cloud architecture, interesting technical challenges, or potential collaborations. Feel free to reach out through any of the links below.
